plugins.name: To the top
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin allows me to move any selected objects to the topmost level of Figma page hierarchy, preserving their absolute positions on the canvas. No more manual dragging, dropping, or adjusting coordinates. Ideal for managing complex nested designs and maintaining a tidy layer structure. Less scroll layers, more control where and how you paste stuff.


It enables two use cases:

  1. Move all selected to the top -> cut -> paste in place in any selected frame or group without moving anything.
  2. Free guides and arrows from being cropped by their parent frames, which is helpful when preparing references and when some modals with clipping=on involved.


Differences from similar plugins - this one support multiple objects, and, doesn't move anything anywhere regardless of whatever coordinates starting pointüòä
plugins.tagline: Move selected elements to the top level of page hierarchy

plugins.name: Color cleaner: Merge similar colors & connect with variables
plugins.description:
About

Color Cleaner is a plugin designed to help streamline your Figma files not only by reducing the number of colors and minimizing subtle variations of the same shade, but also connecting them with variables.


How to use

Use the ‚ÄúLevel of cleanup‚Äù slider to adjust how much cleanup is applied. Preview the changes in the box below and choose a setting that balances effectiveness. Typically, aim for a setting that is neither too soft to make a noticeable difference, nor too hard to avoid merging distinct colors.

Toggle the ‚ÄúMatch with variables‚Äù checkbox if you want colors to be connected with available variables. When ready, click ‚ÄúClean.‚Äù After a brief moment, the changes will be applied to the selected element.

accepted.name: Ruslan Maslenkou
accepted.description: Pragmatic product designer with 5+ years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile applications in devtools, fintech, and crypto products.

plugins.tagline: Merge similar color shades together and connect with variables in 1 click

plugins.name: Auto Layer Numbering
plugins.description:
Auto Page Number


Automatically add and update page numbers in your Figma documents with ease!


Overview:

Auto Page Number is a Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow when working with multi-frame projects. Instead of manually adding page numbers to each frame, this plugin automatically generates and updates them for you. Simply input your desired text layer name (default is "pageNumber"), and with a single click, the plugin will create or update the numbering across all frames in your document.

Run the plugin to transform them into square shapes with the same text content.

Helps maintain visual consistency in your FigJam files.

Whether you're collaborating with teammates or organizing your thoughts visually, this plugin simplifies the process and saves time.

plugins.name: Caravage
plugins.description:
Check easily your design contrast accessibility with the 3.0 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.


About

Caravage allows you to check easily your design contrast accessibility with the 3.0 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.


You can either select individually any text layer or scan a selection and the plugin will automatically give you for each text:

  1. The colour(s) of the text.
  2. The colour(s) of the background directly behind the text.
  3. The font size and weight of the text.
  4. The contrast value based on WCAG 3.0 (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) and the new colour contrast method called APCA (Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm).
  5. The minimum contrast value provided by the APCA contrast look up table.


Credits

  1. This plugin was inspired by another plugin called Contrast.
  2. This plugin use the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm by Andrew Somers.
  3. This plugin use RGBQuant to analyze the colour(s) of the selected text and the background behind it.
  4. This plugin use Figma Plugin DS, a lightweight UI library.
plugins.tagline: Check easily your design contrast accessibility with the 3.0 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines

plugins.name: Wireframeit Plugin
plugins.description:
Transform live websites and HTML into fully editable designs or low-fidelity wireframes. Wireframeit accurately captures the layout, typography, and structure of any site and converts it into editable design files ready to export directly to Figma.


Use the browser extension to scan a live website, export it as a .wfit file, and import it into Figma using this plugin. You'll get clean frames, layout structure, and text boxes, no screenshots, no messy code.


How to use it:

  1. Install the Wireframeit browser extension.
  2. Click the extension on any website ‚Üí Export ‚Üí Figma.
  3. Download the .wfit file.
  4. Open Figma ‚Üí run the Wireframeit plugin.
  5. Drag in the file, hit Import, and start editing.
plugins.tagline: Convert any website into editable Figma designs or wireframes

plugins.name: Layout Switch
plugins.description:
Layout Switch will help you save 95% of your time in switching your UI layouts from LTR layout to RTL or vise versa! Select how many frames you want and choose your destination layout and click on the button. BOOOOM! all the layouts are changed!

Layout Switch is your ultimate Figma plugin for effortlessly converting designs between left-to-right (LTR) and right-to-left (RTL) layouts. Whether you're adapting English designs for Arabic, Persian, or Hebrew, or flipping RTL layouts back to LTR, this plugin makes the process fast, precise, and hassle-free. With support for multiple frames at once, Layout Switch is the perfect tool for designers working on global projects.


üñºÔ∏è Multi-Frame Support:

plugins.name: Dynogee Image Rendering API
plugins.description:
Dynogee is an easy and quick tool to expose your Figma designs as an API:


  1. ‚ú® Swap text and images with dynamic content
  2. üìê Create pixel perfect copies of your design
  3. üèéÔ∏è Supa-fast rendering times, render images on-the-fly
  4. üöÄ We thought of it: custom fonts, truncation, i18n, you name it


It‚Äôs like Figma's Export feature, but as an API. üí´


How to use the plugin


  1. Select a frame in Figma, and open the plugin
  2. Define layers for which you want to provide content via the API
  3. Create your template üöÄ


Pro tip: Set a max height on text layers to enforce truncation. ‚úÇÔ∏è


Features


Full creative freedom

Use your brand fonts, colors and more to create high-fidelity dynamic images ‚ú®


Fast rendering

Our backend is optimized to generate and distribute your images without long wait times. Often images are generated in as little as 200ms.


Handoff your templates to developers

Each template your create comes with it's own documentation and playground environment, making it trivial for your engineering team to make use of the image rendering API.


Contact


If you want to share your feedback, please reach out to us at support@dynogee.com.

plugins.name: Handoff
plugins.description:
Design ü§ù Dev Handoff


Design to dev done right. A Figma plugin to turn design variabes + styles into Tailwind & POSTCSS.


Learn more on Github.


Features


- Convert Figma variables + styles to Tailwind config variables

- Convert Figma text styles to POSTCSS syntax with responsive media queries

- Consolidate design + dev tokens into one source of truth, extensible by designers and developers


Usage


1. Install the plugin from the Figma Community

2. Open the plugin from the Figma toolbar

3. Generate handoff files (.json and .postcss) from the plugin

4. Pass files to developers to integrate into their Tailwind config and Tailwind `@component` layers


Text Styles


The plugin will convert Figma text styles to POSTCSS syntax with responsive media queries. The plugin will also generate a JSON file with the font sizes. The plugin is opinionated as to what gets converted to a class, so it's recommended to review the generated POSTCSS file and adjust as needed.


The POSTCSS file will work from the smallest breakpoint to the largest, assigning media queries using Tailwind's `screen` function as breakpoints appear. Properties are diffed to the base style and only novel properties are added to the media query.

.body-1 {
font-family: Inter;
font-size: 16px;
line-height: 24px;
font-weight: 400;
letter-spacing: 0.5px;

@media screen(md) {
font-size: 2.75rem;
}

@media screen(lg) {
font-size: 3.5rem;
}
}


Naming Schema


The naming schema works so that we capture only the most important classes. For the sake of brevity, we only capture the default classes, defined as not having any variants or as being named the `default` variant.


{viewport}/{style}/{variant}


- `viewport` - The viewport size in Tailwind syntax (e.g. `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`). This corresponds directly to the `Screens` variables, so a matching entry should exist in that variable collection.

- `style` - The Figma text style name, such as `display-1` or `body-3`. This is semantic and can be named anything, but it should be consistent across the design system. The styles for this should be the _default_ styles, as in the most common styles used in the design system for this type of text.

- `variant` - The variant of the style in semantic or property synax, such as `bold`, `italic`, `uppercase`, `lowercase`, `capitalize`, `normal`, `underline`, `line-through`, `no-underline`. This is optional and can be omitted if the style does not have a variant. NOTE: A `default` style MUST be named here in order to be converted to POSTCSS (ex: `md/body-3/default`).


Variables


The plugin will convert Figma variables and effects styles to Tailwind config variables via a resulting JSON file matching the Tailwind configuration. The plugin is optimized to account for a few key properties such as `screens`, `spacing`, `backdropBlur`, `blur`, `borderRadius`, etc, which are numbers converted specially to corresponding formats. The ability to customize a properties format is in the works. Need it sooner? Open an issue and we can prioritize it.


NOTE Library names *must* match the proper Tailwind config name in order to extend the configuration properly.


{
"colors": {
"primary": "#FF0000",
"secondary": "#00FF00",
"tertiary": "#0000FF"
},
"spacing": {
"1": "0.25rem",
"2": "0.5rem",
"3": "0.75rem"
},
"screens": {
"sm": "640px",
"md": "768px",
"lg": "1024px",
"xl": "1280px"
}
}

accepted.name: The DataFace
accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.tagline: Design to dev with Tailwind in mind

plugins.name: Numeric Tokens Generator
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with a comprehensive design system generator that creates and manages typography, spacing, border radius, and shadow systems - all powered by Figma variables.


Key Features:

üìù Complete Typography System

  1. Generate responsive typography scales with Material Design or Apple HIG guidelines
  2. Smart font pairing validation for optimal readability
  3. Automatic variable creation for font sizes and line heights
  4. Support for custom type scales and base sizes
  5. Responsive typography with desktop, tablet, and mobile variants (Pro)


‚ÜîÔ∏è Spacing System

  1. Create consistent spacing scales based on 4px or 8px grids
  2. Generate spacing variables for margins, padding, and layout
  3. Customizable number of spacing increments
  4. Visual preview of spacing values


‚ö™ Border Radius System

  1. Build systematic border radius scales
  2. Customizable base radius and increments
  3. Visual preview of radius values
  4. Perfect for maintaining consistent component shapes


üé≠ Shadow System

  1. Create elevation-based shadow systems
  2. Customizable shadow properties (color, blur, spread)
  3. Visual angle control for consistent light sources
  4. Perfect for depth and hierarchy


üì§ Export Options

  1. Web: CSS, SCSS, JSON
  2. Mobile: React Native, Flutter, Android XML, Swift
  3. Variables-first approach for easy updates
  4. Cross-platform consistency


üìö Auto-Documentation

  1. Generate visual documentation for your design system
  2. Automatic style guides with examples
  3. Clear naming conventions
  4. Easy team handoff


üîÑ Smart Updates

  1. Detect existing settings
  2. Update system-wide changes through variables
  3. Maintain consistency across your design files


Perfect for design system creators, UI designers, and teams looking to maintain consistent, scalable design systems across web and mobile platforms.

This plugin is perfect for designers managing complex artboards or repetitive tasks. Boost your workflow and make Figma even more efficient!

plugins.name: Random values generator
plugins.description:
This plugin is created to help you save time and speed up productivity by allowing you generate random values with just a click.

You can quickly create numeric, alphanumeric, or pattern-based random values.

Whether you‚Äôre prototyping, testing input fields, or designing layouts, this plugin ensures precision and speed by generating values tailored to your needs.


How to use

  1. Run the Random Values generator plugin
  2. Select one or multiple text layers
  3. Select the type of values you want, enter your preferred number of character and click on ‚ÄòGenerate values‚Äù
  4. The pattern-based values allow you to define the format in which random values are generated. For example, by using "X" for random alphabets and "#" for random numbers, you can control the structure of the output. Separators such as - (dash), . (dot), and _ (underscore) can also be included to customize the format further.

Example Patterns:

X#XX## could generate D3FR53.

##XX#X-XX## could generate 06CO2M-FC92.

This feature allows you to create structured, randomized values for placeholders, tokens, or testing data with ease.


Use cases:

  1. Populating Placeholder Data : Use the plugin to generate realistic placeholder values for prototypes, such as: Unique identifiers (e.g., serial numbers, order numbers, or product codes).
  2. Form fields like usernames, passwords, or verification codes
  3. Generate unique codes and simulate real world data: Generate pattern-based values to mimic specific real-world data, such as: License plates, invoice numbers, customer IDs, coupons, gift card, events tickets
  4. Testing UI scalability: Check how your designs handle varying lengths and types of values, ensuring components like input fields, labels, and tables remain responsive and visually consistent.


Need any help or have questions? Please reach out


Show me some support
plugins.tagline: Generate random values for your project

plugins.name: pluckpluck
plugins.description:
A plugin that just plucks everything from one side of the cursor. Great for making room for that extra page in a flow.


Right click context menu, or simplest ctrl+, cmd+, search for 'pluck'.


Known issue:

If you hold down the right mouse button as you go through the menus, the selection will be wrong, since you moved the mouse sideways. Click and release, then go through the menus.


Will only select items that are frames or layers on the canvas.


Or do the quick action menu: ctrl/cmd+,
plugins.tagline: Pick up and move. Faster.
